title: Elizabeth Warren unveils plan to reopen investigations into Brett Kavanaugh
text:
Elizabeth Warren would re-open investigations into Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh and Donald Trump's sister Maryanne Trump Barry if elected president, part of her plan to police the judiciary that she released Monday.

In order to re-open the cases against those two and other judges accused of misconduct, Warren proposes to close a loophole that allows federal judges to skirt such probes by retiring or becoming elevated to the Supreme Court.

There were 83 ethics complaints filed against Kavanaugh, Warren claims, which ended with his elevation to the Supreme Court.

Elizabeth Warren released a plan to police the judiciary branch

Elizabeth Warren would re-open investigations into Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh and Donald Trump's sister Maryanne Trump Barry

'Because the Supreme Court is not covered by a Code of Conduct, no procedure exists to file new complaints' against Kavanaugh, Warren notes in her plan, which is laid out on her presidential campaign website.

Warren was among the Democrats who called for Kavanaugh to be impeached after a new book from two New York Times reporters revealed another sexual misconduct allegation against him from his time as a student at Yale University.

Trump Barry retired in April of this year as a federal appellate judge, which ended an investigation into whether she violated a judicial code of conduct by participating in alleged fraudulent tax schemes with her siblings.

Under Warren's plan, Kavanaugh, whose nomination was nearly derailed by accusations of sexual misconduct, would see investigations into him re-opened, as would other judges who retired rather than face investigators.

That includes Ninth Circuit Judge Alex Kozinski who retired after more than 15 female clerks complained he created a 'hostile, demeaning and persistently sexualized environment' and Barry Trump.

In October, the New York Times reported on how the profits and ownership of Fred Trump's real estate empire were transferred to Donald Trump and his siblings in ways designed to avoid gift and estate taxes.

The Trump family denied the allegations.

Barry Trump retired when an investigation into her was open, which ended the probe.

Warren has made combatting corruption a central part of her campaign to be the 2020 Democratic presidential nominee and has been dropping detailed plans on how she proposes to do just that.

Monday's plan tackles the judiciary.

'The basic premise of our legal system is that every person is treated equally in the eyes of the law – including judges,' the Massachusetts senator says in her proposal.

'These changes will not only allow us to ensure accountability for bad actors, including reopening inquiries into the conduct of offenders like Brett Kavanaugh,' she notes. 'They will also hold the vast majority of judges who act in good faith to the highest ethical standards, and in the process, begin to restore accountability and trust in a fair and impartial federal judiciary.'

Maryanne Trump Barry, seen here with her brother Donald Trump in June 2008, retired from the bench after she faced an investigation into allegations she and her siblings participated in tax fraud

Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination was nearly derailed by allegations of sexual misconduct

Her plan dropped on the first day the Supreme Court was back in session, kicking off its fall term. Currently the high court is the only court in the country without a written code of conduct.

Warren's proposal also addresses other areas of the judiciary, including banning judges from deciding for themselves whether they have a conflict of interest in hearing a case before them; forbidding judges from owning or trading individual stock, and requiring Supreme Court justices to give written explanations of their decisions when a party asks for a recusal.

Finally Warren would give strong disciplinary tools to judicial watchdog groups, such as allowing them to take away some pension benefits from judges.
description: Elizabeth Warren would re-open investigations into Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh and Donald Trump's sister Maryanne Trump Barry if elected president.
